metachat.pp.compute_costDistance

metachat.pp.compute_costDistance(adata, LRC_type=None, dis_thr=50.0, k_neighb=5, LRC_strength=100.0, plot=False, spot_size=None, copy=False)[source]

Function for computing LRC-embedding cost distance based on graph construction.

Parameters:

  • adata (AnnData) – The data matrix with shape n_obs × n_var, provided as an anndata object. Rows correspond to cells or spots and columns to genes.

  • LRC_type (Optional[list]) – The name of all possible long-range channel, provided as a list, such as [“Blood”] or [“CSF”] or [“Blood”,”CSF”].

  • dis_thr (float) – The farthest distance from a nearby cell to the LRC indicates the range of cells in which long-range communication can occur, provided as a float.

  • k_neighb (int) – k-nearest neighbors for constructing graph, provided as an int.

  • LRC_strength (float) – Long-range communication strength for computing LRC-embedding cost distance, provided as a float.

  • plot (bool) – Whether or not to plot diagrams showing cells where long-range communication may occur, for each type of LRC and each LRCs in a type.

  • spot_size (Optional[int]) – If plot=True, The size of the spot in the figure. When .uns[‘spatial’][library_id] does not exist, spot_size must be provided directly.

  • copy (bool) – Whether to return a copy of the anndata.AnnData.

Returns:

adata – The calculated distance will be saved in adata.obsp['spatial_distance_LRC_No'] and adata.obsp['spatial_distance_LRC_X'] for each LRC, where ‘X’ is the LRC name. If copy=True, return the AnnData object and return None otherwise.

Return type:

anndata.AnnData
